results.title: Science goes fishing
results.brief_description: Scientists from Laval University and the Federal Fisheries Research Board carry on scientific research in Gaspe to improve cod-fishing. The film tells how much time and patience were needed before the fishing folk of the area would accept scientific methods of fishing.

results.title: Science for the tropics
results.creator_credit: Tony Baker, Richard Tamblind and Technical and Scientific Films
results.brief_description: A look at the work of the Tropical Products Institute in London, an organisation which assists third world countries to exploit their natural resources commercially. The Institute also does much laboratory work relating to agricultural issues. The film contains quite technical examinations of several projects the Institute has been involved in.

results.title: Science for the space age: waves and energy
results.creator_credit: Stanley Croner, Larry Yust and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Explains that there are many kinds of waves, including water, sound, light and radio waves. Uses illustrations and experiments to show how waves carry energy from one place to another. Describes the relationship between frequency and wave length; and explains how radio waves carry information.

results.title: Science fiction: towards the twentieth century
results.creator_credit: Roger Thompson, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description: Explores the ways in which the social and technological changes of the 19th century led writers to think of the future world as a very different world from the present. Shows the themes which pre-occupied Victorians were taken up by writers of predicive fiction and projected into the 20th century and beyond. Shows excerpts from “Things to come” and book illustrations from “War of the worlds” and “Time machine”. Presented by Simon Eliot. Novel excerpts read by Patrick Troughton. Suitable for secondary level.

group_works.title: Know your foods

results.title: Schubert and his music
results.brief_description: Depicts life in the early 19th century and the people and places of Vienna which have had an important influence on the music of Franz Schubert. Shows Schubert’s birth place, the church where he sang as a boy and where, later, his music was performed, life in Vienna and the group of singers, painters, poets and actors who were part of the romantic movement of this period. Excerpts from the following are included in the film: Valses Nobles, Opus 77; Moment Musicaux, Opus 94; the First and Second Movements of the Symphony No. 8 “Unfinished”; “Der Lindenbaum”; the First Movement of the Quintet in A Major, Opus 114 “The Trout”; and “Serenade”.

results.title: Schools working with curriculum frameworks
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, David Ferris and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch
results.brief_description: Trevor Lunn introduces a panel including Dr. Max Stephens, Anne Gooding, Mary Weaven, Enid Mayfield, Geoff Whyte, Denis Cunningham and Geoff Burt who explain how the key ideas and issues of Curriculum Frameworks are being addressed by Schools. This panel of teachers and regional consultants discuss several specific frameworks areas.

results.title: Schools out
results.creator_credit: Alex Rappel, Ross Campbell and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: Examines three innovative schools - Brinsley Road an annexe to Camberwell High school, Collingwood Community school, and Swinburne Community school. Students and teachers comment on the differences between these and traditional schools, and the relationships between pupils, teachers, and the community.
